description: Portfolio website enhancements - mobile nav, contact form, accessibility, and content additions

userStories.title: Add mobile navigation menu
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want to access the navigation menu so I can browse all sections of the site.
acceptanceCriteria: Hamburger menu icon visible on screens < 768px
Tapping hamburger opens slide-out navigation menu
Menu includes all existing nav links (About, Achievements, Experience, etc.)
Menu closes when clicking outside or selecting a link
Smooth animation for menu open/close
Accessible via keyboard (focus states, ESC to close)
Tests pass (npm run test:run)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill or manual mobile testing

userStories.title: Add print stylesheet
userStories.description: As a recruiter, I want to print a clean version of the CV so I can review it offline.
acceptanceCriteria: Create @media print CSS rules
Remove dark theme colors (use light colors only)
Hide navigation, theme toggle, and footer
Remove animations and transitions
Optimize layout for A4 page size
Ensure all text is black on white background
Page breaks positioned sensibly between sections
Tests pass (npm run test:run)

userStories.title: Add testimonials section
userStories.description: As a potential employer, I want to see recommendations from colleagues so I can validate Greg's expertise.
acceptanceCriteria: New section between case-studies and philosophy sections
Section titled 'Testimonials' or 'What People Say'
Include 3-4 testimonial cards with: quote, name, role, company
Use placeholder content (Greg can update later with real testimonials)
Responsive grid layout matching existing design patterns
Hover effects consistent with achievement cards
Tests pass (npm run test:run)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Add project portfolio section
userStories.description: As a technical recruiter, I want to see concrete projects Greg has worked on so I can assess technical capabilities.
acceptanceCriteria: New section after skills section titled 'Projects' or 'Portfolio'
Include 3-4 project cards with: title, description, tech stack, links (GitHub/demo)
Use placeholder projects (can include: this portfolio site, Second Brain, Situation Dashboard, Dexter, etc.)
Each card shows tech tags similar to skills section
Optional: screenshots or project thumbnails
Responsive grid layout
Tests pass (npm run test:run)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Improve accessibility with ARIA labels
userStories.description: As a screen reader user, I want proper ARIA labels on interactive elements so I can navigate the site effectively.
acceptanceCriteria: Add aria-label to all navigation links
Add aria-label to download CV button
Add aria-label to contact button
Ensure all interactive elements have focus states
Add skip-to-content link for keyboard navigation
Verify heading hierarchy is logical (h1 → h2 → h3)
Run accessibility audit (Lighthouse or axe-core)
Tests pass (npm run test:run)

userStories.title: Add Formspree contact form
userStories.description: As a potential employer, I want to contact Greg directly through the website so I don't have to use LinkedIn.
acceptanceCriteria: Replace 'Other contact details available upon request' with contact form
Form fields: Name (required), Email (required), Message (required)
Use Formspree free tier (https://formspree.io/)
Form styled to match existing design (bg-tertiary, border, rounded)
Submit button with loading state and success/error feedback
Form validation (email format, required fields)
Success message: 'Thanks! I'll get back to you soon.'
Error handling with user-friendly messages
Tests pass (npm run test:run)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: NOTE: Formspree requires email verification. Use placeholder endpoint initially, add note for Greg to configure real endpoint.

userStories.title: Add blog/articles section
userStories.description: As a hiring manager, I want to see Greg's thought leadership so I can assess his expertise and communication skills.
acceptanceCriteria: New section after interests section titled 'Articles' or 'Insights'
Include 2-3 article cards with: title, excerpt, publish date, read time
Use placeholder articles on agile topics (e.g., 'Scaling Scrum Beyond 10 Teams', 'Breaking Down UX Silos')
Each card links to # (Greg can add real articles later)
Responsive grid layout
Visual consistency with existing sections
Tests pass (npm run test:run)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Performance optimization
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want the site to load quickly so I don't waste data or time.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement lazy loading for intersection observer animations
Defer non-critical JavaScript
Add loading='lazy' to any images (if added in other stories)
Minify inline SVGs
Run Lighthouse performance audit
Achieve Lighthouse performance score > 90
No console errors or warnings
Tests pass (npm run test:run)
